page.title: 14KEEP MOTHERWELL TIDY
page.content: {Keep Motherwell District Tidy Campaign started in Spring 1983 and will last at least 5 years and may be extended. It was started by Motherwell District Council with help from{Keep Scotland {Tidy}and{Keep Britain Tidy.} There are 48 workers; half work in schools and half in the local communities. It was started to help keep Motherwell cleaner and to make it more attractive to new industries. The two main problems are the dumping of rubbish and dog-fouling. Motherwell District Council fund the project, though local companies, over 100 so far, sponsor bins, prizes for competitions and give the campaign free use of equipment. The campaign has been a success so far but Motherwell will be clenaer still in 5 years and, hopefully, even better in 15 years time.
